title: How to Cook a Filling and Healthy Dinner Time Soup

steps.headline: Mix corn flour in half a cup of room temperature water till it becomes smooth.
steps.description: Crumble in the egg yolks and mix again till smooth. Keep aside.

steps.headline: Keep water to heat on medium flame(read tip)
In another non stick pot, heat olive oil on medium flame.
Add garlic paste, fry till the raw smell goes away.
steps.description: Add the cut vegetables and stir. Add salt & seasoning to taste.

steps.headline: Cover with a lid and let the vegetables cook in the steam on low flame.
steps.description: After 5 minutes, add in the shredded chicken and chicken stock. Cover with lid & let it cook for 5 more minutes.

steps.headline: Add the corn flour paste to the heated water and stir till it dissolved completely.
steps.description: Bring to a boil, add little salt. Keep stirring to avoid lumps.

steps.headline: Once you see the liquid thickening, add in the vegetables and stir for 2 minutes.
Your soup is done!
steps.description: Sprinkle parsley & ground pepper. Serve piping hot.

text: Mix corn flour in half a cup of room temperature water till it becomes smooth. Crumble in the egg yolks and mix again till smooth. Keep aside. Keep water to heat on medium flame(read tip)  In another non stick pot, heat olive oil on medium flame.  Add garlic paste, fry till the raw smell goes away. Add the cut vegetables and stir. Add salt & seasoning to taste. Cover with a lid and let the vegetables cook in the steam on low flame. After 5 minutes, add in the shredded chicken and chicken stock. Cover with lid & let it cook for 5 more minutes. Add the corn flour paste to the heated water and stir till it dissolved completely. Bring to a boil, add little salt. Keep stirring to avoid lumps. Once you see the liquid thickening, add in the vegetables and stir for 2 minutes.  Your soup is done! Sprinkle parsley & ground pepper. Serve piping hot.
